title: Statistics Bee
text:
First Annual Statistics Bee

Saturday, April 22, 2023 at 10am  University of California, Santa Barbara


Welcome to the official webpage of the Statistics Bee! Modeled after MIT’s Integration Bee, this event is designed to test the probabilistic prowess of contestants. On this site you can find more information about the Bee including Rules, Regulations, and an Application Form. We hope you can attend, either as a contestant or an audience member!

title: Apply
text:
We’d love to have you apply! The application process is fairly straightforward: please fill out the Google Form linked below, and further instructions will be sent to you upon receipt of your form.

Click Here to Apply!



Application URL: https://bit.ly/statsbee1apply

title: About
text:
A full handbook of rules and regulations pertaining to the Bee can be found here.



Qualification Round
All interested applicants must first undergo the Qualification Exam, which is currently scheduled for Date and Time TBD. The Examination will take the form of a 5-10 question exam, designed to ensure contestants are adequately prepared to participate in the Bee. Though there are no formal prerequisites for entry, preparation equivalent to PSTAT 120B mastery (Mathematical Statistics) is recommended.

A sample Qualification Exam will be posted shortly.




The Bee
Only the top scorers of the Qualification Exam will be invited to continue to the main portion of the Bee (though all are welcome to attend the Bee as audience members!)
